text: Christian Haller Lindsay [Pinky or The Crab] (July 24, 1878 – January 25, 1941) was a first baseman in Major League Baseball who played in and for the Detroit Tigers. Listed at , 190 lb., Lindsay batted and threw right-handed. He was born in Moon Township, Pennsylvania. In two-season career, Lindsay was a .242 hitter (200-for-828) with 97 runs and 64 RBI in 229 games, including 30 doubles, three triples, and 28 stolen bases without home runs.
